org.lenskit.data.ratings

Class PreferenceDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.data.ratings.PreferenceDomain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @Shareable
@DefaultNull
public final class PreferenceDomain
extends Object
implements Serializable

    An object describing the domain of preference data, used in ratings and predictions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PreferenceDomain

        public PreferenceDomain(double min,
                double max,
                double prec)

        Create a discrete bounded preference domain.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum preference value.
        max - The maximum preference value.
        prec - The preference precision (if 0 or Double.NaN, the domain is continuous).

      • PreferenceDomain

        public PreferenceDomain(double min,
                double max)

        Create a continuous bounded preference domain.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum preference value.
        max - The maximum preference value.

      • hasPrecision

        public boolean hasPrecision()

        Query whether this preference domain has a precision.

        Returns:
        true if the domain has a precision for discrete rating values, false if it is continuous.

      • getPrecision

        public double getPrecision()

        The precision of preference values. This is the precision with which data is collected from the user â€” in a 1-5, half-star rating system, it will be 0.5.

        Returns:
        The preference precision; the return value is undefined if the preference domain has no precision.
        See Also:
        hasPrecision()

      • clampValue

        public double clampValue(double v)

        Clamp a value to this preference domain.

        Parameters:
        v - The value to clamp.
        Returns:
        The value, restricted to be in the range [minimum,maximum].

      • fromString

        @Nonnull
public static PreferenceDomain fromString(@Nonnull
                                  String spec)

        Parse a preference domain from a string specification.

        Continuous preference domains are specified as [min, max]; discrete domains as min:max[/prec/. For example, a 0.5-5.0 half-star rating scale is represented as [0.5, 5.0]/0.5.

        Parameters:
        spec - The string specifying the preference domain.
        Returns:
        The preference domain represented by spec.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if spec is not a valid domain specification.

      • fromSpec

        public static PreferenceDomain fromSpec(PrefDomainSpec spec)

        Build a preference domain from a specification.

        Parameters:
        spec - The preference domain spec.
        Returns:
        The preference domain.

      • newBuilder

        public static PreferenceDomainBuilder newBuilder()

        Create a new preference domain builder.

        Returns:
        A new preference domain builder.
